image.altText: Peter George and Craig Garland outside parliament following a meeting with Labor 2025-08-07 10:08:00

props.synopsis: A strong critic of Tasmania's salmon industry says the Liberal government has "ambushed" those who supported it to remain in power, by "dumping" the terms of reference of a promised review into fish farming "without further consultation".

title.children: Rockliff will 'rue the day', Peter George says, amid anger over salmon study

image.altText: A man holds a sign that reads, Unpaid, stand down.

props.synopsis: Teachers, health workers and firefighters have walked off the job in Tasmania's north-west, with further stop-work action planned in other parts of the state over the next two days.

title.children: 'Feeling undervalued': Teachers, other public workers begin strikes in Tasmania

image.altText: A close-up of a locked gate inside a prison.

props.synopsis: A female Aboriginal prisoner has died in custody after a "serious medical episode", Tasmania's director of prisons has confirmed.

title.children: Female Aboriginal prisoner dies in custody in Tasmania

image.altText: Penguins near Casey Station

props.synopsis: A document linked to the arrest of a scientist has raised questions about whether Russia has long-term ambitions to exploit oil resources in Antarctica, where mining is banned indefinitely.

title.children: Russia's interest in Antarctic oil exposed after scientist's arrest

image.altText: A WA Police officer holds a small black metal detector wand.

props.synopsis: Tasmania Police confirms despite five knife-detecting wands being available, none were being used by officers in Hobart on the night of an alleged stabbing murder.

title.children: Knife-detecting wands not used by police on night of fatal Hobart stabbing

image.altText: A baby's hand clenched in a fist in a bed with bumble bee printed sheets

props.synopsis: The University of Tasmania will be able to train midwives locally from next year with the graduate diploma of midwifery to be reinstated from June 2026.

title.children: 🔉 LISTEN: Will reinstating the graduate diploma of midwifery encourage midwives to stay in Tasmania?

image.altText: Older man and woman smiling on beach

props.synopsis: Life as the caretaker of a tropical island includes gardening and plenty of birdwatching, but the job is not all glamorous.

title.children: Couple trades Tasmania for new adventure as tropical islands' caretakers

image.altText: A range of firearms sitting on a table.

props.synopsis: Almost three decades after Australia's worst-ever mass shooting, the total number of firearms in the country is the highest it has ever been but the surge in illegal guns is not due to 3D-printed weapons or black-market imports from overseas.

title.children: Guns being stolen and stripped down to be sold on the black market

image.altText: Tyler Robinson standing against grey wall.

props.synopsis: A US judge has agreed Tyler Robinson's case has drawn "extraordinary" public and media attention.

title.children: Suspect in Charlie Kirk killing can wear street clothes in court

image.altText: A man types on a laptop computer which is resting on his lap. The backround is lit with red light.

props.synopsis: Paedophiles are using the dark web to share information about how to gain access to childcare centres to sexually abuse babies and toddlers while avoiding getting caught.

title.children: 'Hunting in packs': Paedophiles share tips about abusing children in childcare

image.altText: Murray Watt doorstop

props.synopsis: Environment Minister Murray Watt has been grilled by Labor MPs anxious that the government's environmental reform bill will be watered down in order to secure a deal to pass it. Follow live.

title.children: Murray Watt grilled by Labor MPs on key environmental reforms

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Exclusive: First NZYQ cohort member deported to Nauru
Labor MPs quiz minister over details of environment reforms

image.altText: Close up of grey-suited real estate auctioneer holding a wooden hammer and folded papers.

props.synopsis: Whether or not we're delivered a rate cut next Tuesday, there's a solid argument that the RBA should once again consider using its powers to curb runaway real estate prices.

title.children: Why the RBA should put a handbrake on property prices

image.altText: A woman and man, Sarah Ferguson and Prince Andrew, stand side by side.

props.synopsis: Prince Andrew is a "hypocrite" who believes he is above the law, according to author Andrew Lownie, who has written an unauthorised biography on the under siege royal.

title.children: Prince Andrew an 'accident waiting to happen', friends told biographer

image.altText: Man walks past CSL signage

props.synopsis: WiseTech Global shares plunge after the firm's Sydney offices are raided. Biotech giant CSL's shares slump as it downgrades guidance and delays a spin-off. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX in the red as CSL, WiseTech and rare earth stocks dive

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Brisbane hailstorm declared a 'significant event' by Insurance Council
Tomago aluminium bailout should come with a public stake, Greens say

image.altText: Richard White stands in front of office windows, with rooftops and trees visible behind him

props.synopsis: WiseTech says it was required to produce documents related to alleged trading in WiseTech shares by controversial co-founder Richard White and three employees from late 2024 to early 2025.

title.children: WiseTech shares crash after AFP and ASIC raid office

image.altText: Massage generic showing unidentified woman giving man a massage

props.synopsis: Canberra Institute of Technology has not been offering remedial massage training for more than a year due to a "review". Industry professionals are concerned the delay in reinstating the course will result in not enough therapists to meet demand.

title.children: Massage helps Andrew function, but a shortage of therapists has him worried

image.altText: The March for Australia rally in Adelaide.

props.synopsis: A man arrested for allegedly holding a placard depicting suspected police killer Dezi Freeman at an anti-immigration rally in Adelaide will be formally cautioned, SA Police say.

title.children: Man to be cautioned over Dezi Freeman placard at anti-immigration rally

image.altText: Richard Marles and Pat Conroy press conference

props.synopsis: A group of Pacific nations created to respond to humanitarian catastrophes will have an expanded remit, including "stabilisation" missions.

title.children: Australia to form part of Pacific 'taskforce' set to stir regional controversy

image.altText: An NRL player walking during a warm-up before a match at night.

props.synopsis: Tom Trbojevic's contract saga with Manly is over after the superstar fullback agreed to a one-year deal that will keep him at the NRL club until the end of 2027.

title.children: Tom Trbojevic signs one-year contract extension with Sea Eagles

image.altText: Steven van de Velde diving for the ball

props.synopsis: Convicted Dutch child rapist Steven van de Velde has been denied a visa to Australia to compete in the Beach Volleyball World Championships.

title.children: Convicted rapist denied visa for volleyball competition

image.altText: Britain’s King Charles reacts by holding his hand up to his head

props.synopsis: The protester outside the cathedral could also be heard saying "have you asked the police to cover up for Andrew, sir?"

title.children: King Charles heckled with 'how long have you known?' about Prince Andrew

image.altText: Police officers testing drivers for cannabis near Nimbin

props.synopsis: The government says it was "investigating" a medical defence for drivers prescribed cannabis but ruled out the use of sniffer dogs and strip searches for suspected drug possession at music festivals in its response to last year's drug summit.

title.children: Medical cannabis defence for NSW drivers rejected for now

image.altText: Person with glasses and green hair.

props.synopsis: Teens with disabilities say they might end up losing contact with friends and online communities due to being banned from social media.

title.children: How the social media ban will impact teens with a disability

image.altText: A montage of images including the back of a person and two newspaper clippings, one with a headline about "fondle claims".

props.synopsis: Victims of a paedophile who used children's artwork to hide abuse are suing the Victorian Education Department, alleging his abuse should have been stopped earlier.

title.children: Victims say paedophile teacher groomed them to believe students were his 'wives'

image.altText: Shane Chelepy in uniform.

props.synopsis: Queensland Police Service Deputy Commissioner Shane Chelepy is praised for seeing the state through times of disaster during his 40-year career.

title.children: One of Queensland's top cops announces retirement after 40 years

image.altText: Donald Trump and Benjamin Netanyahu speaking.

props.synopsis: Some of the most senior officials from the US arriving in Israel has prompted some to re-imagine the phrase "Bibi-sitting" — and question the motive behind it.

title.children: US officials descending on Israel spark claims of 'Bibi-sitting'

image.altText: Palm trees blowing in strong winds before a hurricane hits jamaica

props.synopsis: Having intensified into a category five system, Hurricane Melissa looks set to be the strongest hurricane to hit Jamaica since record-keeping began in 1851.

title.children: 'Catastrophic' category five Hurricane Melissa begins lashing Jamaica

image.altText: a shutdown nuclear power plant in iowa

props.synopsis: Google has announced a nuclear facility shuttered in 2020 will return to service in 2029 to help power its "growing cloud and AI infrastructure in Iowa", a year after Microsoft signed on to reopen Three Mile Island.

title.children: Google, Microsoft to reopen old nuclear plants to power AI infrastructure

image.altText: A shot from a low angle of a middle-aged woman in black sitting at a table.

props.synopsis: In 2020, Australia massively increased welfare payments and conducted a live experiment in ending poverty, but when the subsidy was removed, many were thrown back into hardship. Leaving aside the moral dimension, would it be cheaper to end poverty than to maintain it?

title.children: Price of poverty hurts us all, yet research reveals an easy fix

image.altText: A graphic of a young unidentified girl sitting on a chair, her face down, in a Family Court waiting room.

props.synopsis: Sally's legal battle in the Federal Circuit and Family Court of Australia may be years long gone, but the trauma of the experience lingers — especially on her eldest child.

title.children: Kids left powerless in 'disgusting custody battles' at Family Court

image.altText: Two men and a woman, who are brothers and sister, smiling.

props.synopsis: Virginia Roberts Giuffre's brothers are calling for the Epstein files, which they believe include videotapes, to be released. One says he knew for years about her allegation against their father.

title.children: 'Known for a long time': Giuffre's brother opens up on rape allegations against father

image.altText: A smiling man and woman, both with dark hair and dressed in Australian sports uniforms, on an ice rink.

props.synopsis: Despite being set to take the world number one mixed-doubles ranking, Australian curling duo Tahli Gill and Dean Hewitt still face a major challenge in booking their spot at their second Winter Olympics.

title.children: Aussie curlers face tough Olympic qualification despite purple patch

image.altText: uncoloured image of a man in historic army uniform with capped hat and glasses

props.synopsis: Family members of two World War I soldiers have been left stunned after a bottle containing hand-written letters was found on a WA beach.

title.children: A WWI-era message in a bottle is a letter 'from the grave' for family
